itemDescription: British Army officer from the 1890s to the 1920s

wikipedia_page.main: Major General Edward Bailey Ashmore,  (20 February 1872 – 5 October 1953) was a British Army officer from the 1890s to the 1920s who served in the Royal Artillery, the Royal Flying Corps and briefly in the Royal Air Force before founding and developing the organisation that would become the Royal Observer Corps.
